title: Teaching Professor, Gies RC Evans Innovation Fellow, CITL Fellow
biography: Lawrence Angrave is a Teaching Professor at the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign. He has a Ph.D. in Computer Science from the University of Illinois and has been teaching at the university since 2006. His research interests include accessible education, effective computer science instruction at scale, and universal design for learning.
researchStatement: My research focuses on improving accessibility and effectiveness of computer science education. I am interested in developing and evaluating new methods and tools for teaching computer science, particularly for students with disabilities.

researchInterests.description: Developing and evaluating methods and tools to improve accessibility of computer science education for students with disabilities.
Investigating effective methods for teaching computer science at scale, including the use of technology and innovative pedagogies.
